intro: Canthium laurinum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Canthium laurinum is typically found in moist, shady environments such as forests and along stream banks. It is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
